quote: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.
author: Plutarch

quote: The final wisdom of life requires not the annulment of incongruity but the achievement of serenity within and above it.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Every nation whose affairs betray a want of wisdom and stability may calculate on every loss which can be sustained from the more systematic policy of its wiser neighbors.
author: James Madison

quote: Ignorance and bungling with love are better than wisdom and skill without.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: If you were to offer a thirsty man all wisdom, you would not please him more than if you gave him a drink.
author: Sophocles

quote: I'm married. My wife, Stella - a beautiful woman. She's brought a lot of peace to my life, a lot of wisdom.
author: Anthony Hopkins

quote: I learned some valuable lessons about the legislative process, the importance of bipartisan cooperation and the wisdom of taking small steps to get a big job done.
author: Hillary Clinton

quote: When I wrote Living in the Light, I wanted to share about how I live my own life and to encourage people to tap into their own inner wisdom.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: It doesn't matter how much wisdom you have. If you don't have position, you have nothing. That's the tragedy of India.
author: Rahul Gandhi

quote: Each of us finds his unique vehicle for sharing with others his bit of wisdom.
author: Ram Dass

quote: It is plain to me that our prelates, in granting indulgences, do commonly blaspheme the wisdom of God.
author: John Wycliffe

quote: What I want is to have people's notion of adulthood no longer be so defined by being a parent. There is some kind of conventional wisdom that you're not really a mature person until you become a parent.
author: Meghan Daum

quote: I know that inner wisdom is more precious than wealth. The more you spend it, the more you gain.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: When you get older, you learn certain life lessons. You apply that wisdom, and suddenly you say, 'Hey, I've got a new lease on this thing. So let's go.'
author: Robert Redford

quote: The thing that we possess, that machines don't, is the ability to exhibit wisdom.
author: Herbie Hancock

quote: I find that to be a fool as to worldly wisdom, and to commit my cause to God, not fearing to offend men, who take offence at the simplicity of truth, is the only way to remain unmoved at the sentiments of others.
author: John Woolman

quote: The first point of wisdom is to discern that which is false; the second, to know that which is true.
author: Lactantius

quote: Genius unrefined resembles a flash of lightning, but wisdom is like the sun.
author: Franz Grillparzer

quote: History is filled with tragic examples of wars that result from diplomatic impasse. Whether in our local communities or in international relations, the skillful use of our communicative capacities to negotiate and resolve differences is the first evidence of human wisdom.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: The woods were a boon; all too often, the forest offered danger and mystery. Yet it could be liberating. If you entered that wild place on its own terms, you might be accorded wisdom.
author: John Burnside

quote: A grandparent can be simply affirming. A grandparent has been there, done that child-raising stuff, and has the wisdom of experience. And so in some ways, they're free to love without the anxiety of being the actual parents. They're free to give.
author: Jewell Parker Rhodes

quote: There is a wisdom in this beyond the rules of physic: a man's own observation what he finds good of and what he finds hurt of is the best physic to preserve health.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Sometimes in international politics, the better part of wisdom is to defer dangers rather than try to eliminate them altogether instantly.
author: Zbigniew Brzezinski

quote: Mothers are supposed to listen and, afterward, to respond with some wisdom and perspective, but these things were not my mother's strong suit.
author: Anne Lamott

quote: What I've been able to do with my character, Madea, and the other characters, with the jokes, is use it as an anesthetic to get to the heart and soul of real issues. And what I've found on stage over the years is that, while making people laugh, I can drop in pearls of wisdom.
author: Tyler Perry

quote: If you have a vaccine or an antidote that people can benefit from, you're not going to want to keep it to yourself. You're going to want to spread that wisdom or whatever to as many people as you can, so everybody can benefit from it.
author: will.i.am

quote: Protection, as we use the word in Buddhism, is actually wisdom, it's insight. Protection is seeing and knowing deeply that all things in our experience arise due to causes, due to conditions coming together in a certain way.
author: Sharon Salzberg

quote: I sought my father in the world of the black musician, because it contained wisdom, experience, sadness and loneliness. I was not ever interested in the music of boys. From my youngest years, I was interested in the music of men.
author: Eric Clapton

quote: If we have built on the fragile cornerstones of human wisdom, pride, and conditional love, things may look good for a while, but a weak foundation causes collapse when storms hit.
author: Charles Stanley

quote: Through the years, I, like you, have experienced pressures and disappointments that would have crushed me had I not been able to draw upon a source of wisdom and strength far greater than my own. He has never forgotten or forsaken me, and I have come to know for myself that Jesus is the Christ and that this is His Church.
author: Sheri L. Dew

quote: You know how people always talk about how vision is the key to entrepreneurship and perseverance and really seeing what other people don't see? We can actually redeem a fair amount of that folk wisdom.
author: Eric Ries

quote: I think we do need to try to not just rely on the central bank to, in its wisdom, adjust interest rates, but allow for people to avoid being exposed to inflation risk.
author: Robert J. Shiller

quote: The superior man blames himself. The inferior man blames others.
author: Don Shula

quote: I love wisdom. And you can never be great at anything unless you love it. Not be in love with it, but love the thing, admire the thing. And it seems that if you love the thing, and you don't just want to possess it, it will find you.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: When an opponent comes forward, move in and greet him; if he wants to pull back, send him on his way.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

quote: Since human wisdom cannot secure us from accidents, it is the greatest effort of reason to bear them well.
author: John Paul Jones

quote: That which seems the height of absurdity in one generation often becomes the height of wisdom in another.
author: Adlai E. Stevenson

quote: If an idea is indeed sensible, it will eventually become just part of the accepted wisdom.
author: Nigel Farage

quote: Both in thought and in feeling, even though time be real, to realise the unimportance of time is the gate of wisdom.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Cynicism masquerades as wisdom, but it is the furthest thing from it. Because cynics don't learn anything. Because cynicism is a self-imposed blindness: a rejection of the world because we are afraid it will hurt us or disappoint us. Cynics always say 'no.' But saying 'yes' begins things. Saying 'yes' is how things grow.
author: Stephen Colbert

quote: Applause is a receipt, not a bill.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: The wheel that squeaks the loudest is the one that gets the grease.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Irony is the gaiety of reflection and the joy of wisdom.
author: Anatole France

quote: A fool flatters himself, a wise man flatters the fool.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quote: There is a wisdom of the head, and a wisdom of the heart.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: I will give you a definition of a proud man: he is a man who has neither vanity nor wisdom one filled with hatreds cannot be vain, neither can he be wise.
author: John Keats

quote: Be happy. It's one way of being wise.
author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette

quote: Combine the extremes, and you will have the true center.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: Look twice before you leap.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: To be satisfied with a little, is the greatest wisdom; and he that increaseth his riches, increaseth his cares; but a contented mind is a hidden treasure, and trouble findeth it not.
author: Akhenaton

quote: Through mutual understanding, sincerity and goodwill, and with great wisdom and broad views, the leaders on both sides should jointly initiate new opportunities for peace, stability, cooperation and mutual benefit.
author: Chen Shui-bian

quote: Never reach out your hand unless you're willing to extend an arm.
author: Pope Paul VI

quote: When a thing is done, it's done. Don't look back. Look forward to your next objective.
author: George C. Marshall

quote: We never understand how little we need in this world until we know the loss of it.
author: James M. Barrie

quote: The virtue of justice consists in moderation, as regulated by wisdom.
author: Aristotle

quote: Kindness is wisdom.
author: Philip James Bailey

quote: The hours of folly are measured by the clock; but of wisdom, no clock can measure.
author: William Blake

quote: It seems to me that, in every culture, I come across a chapter headed 'Wisdom.' And then I know exactly what is going to follow: 'Vanity of vanities, all is vanity.'
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: If suffering brings wisdom, I would wish to be less wise.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: There's something peculiar about writing fiction. It requires an interesting balance between seeing the world as a child and having the wisdom of a middle-aged person. The further you get from childhood and the experience of the teenage years, the greater the danger of losing that wellspring.
author: Kazuo Ishiguro

quote: Singleness of purpose is one of the chief essentials for success in life, no matter what may be one's aim.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: It is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Before we acquire great power we must acquire wisdom to use it well.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Plodding wins the race.
author: Aesop

quote: It is better to rust out than wear out.
author: Edwin Markham

quote: First appearance deceives many.
author: Ovid

quote: Let deeds match words.
author: Plautus

quote: Habit, if not resisted, soon becomes necessity.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: The fall of dropping water wears away the Stone.
author: Lucretius

quote: I didn't get where I am today by worryin' about how I'd feel tomorrow.
author: Ron White

quote: Authority without wisdom is like a heavy ax without an edge, fitter to bruise than polish.
author: Anne Bradstreet

quote: Doubt the conventional wisdom unless you can verify it with reason and experiment.
author: Steve Albini

quote: All wisdom does not reside in Delhi.
author: P. Chidambaram

quote: Some coaches pray for wisdom. I pray for 260-pound tackles. They'll give me plenty of wisdom.
author: Chuck Noll

quote: While people are quick to praise the wisdom of the crowd, being an old-school journalist, I look at the wisdom of the crowd and know it can quickly turn into a mob mentality.
author: Jason Calacanis

quote: Habit is the nursery of errors.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: The extreme limit of wisdom, that's what the public calls madness.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: No party has a monopoly on wisdom. No democracy works without compromise. But when Governor Romney and his allies in Congress tell us we can somehow lower our deficit by spending trillions more on new tax breaks for the wealthy - well, you do the math. I refuse to go along with that. And as long as I'm President, I never will.
author: Barack Obama

quote: If people can't acknowledge the wisdom of indigenous cultures, then that's their loss.
author: Jay Griffiths

quote: Memory is the mother of all wisdom.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Look around for a place to sow a few seeds.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: If you call failures experiments, you can put them in your resume and claim them as achievements.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: A mouse does not rely on just one hole.
author: Plautus

quote: Wisdom outweighs any wealth.
author: Sophocles

quote: An ounce of cheerfulness is worth a pound of sadness to serve God with.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Man's wisdom is his best friend folly his worst enemy.
author: William Temple

quote: Gray hairs are signs of wisdom if you hold your tongue, speak and they are but hairs, as in the young.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Mixing one's wines may be a mistake, but old and new wisdom mix admirably.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: The only medicine for suffering, crime, and all other woes of mankind, is wisdom. Teach a man to read and write, and you have put into his hands the great keys of the wisdom box. But it is quite another thing to open the box.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: We must learn from the sermons of Christ, the wisdom of Laotzu, the teachings of Buddha.
author: Charles Lindbergh

quote: Wisdom is knowing when you can't be wise.
author: Paul Engle

quote: Many people have their reputations as reporters and analysts because they are on television, batting around conventional wisdom. A lot of these people have never reported a story.
author: Bob Woodward

quote: A wholesome oblivion of one's neighbours is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Richard Le Gallienne

quote: Wisdom oft times consists of knowing what to do next.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: It is astonishing what force, purity, and wisdom it requires for a human being to keep clear of falsehoods.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: If you have the insight of non-self, if you have the insight of impermanence, you should make that insight into a concentration that you keep alive throughout the day. Then what you say, what you think, and what you do will then be in the light of that wisdom and you will avoid making mistakes and creating suffering.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: The best wisdom is earned through experience, particularly mistakes.
author: Sophia Amoruso

quote: Multicolored stones and paintings, walkways, and theaters are useless in a city unless it also contains wisdom and law. Such things are the subject of wisdom and law, not equivalent to them.
author: Apollonius of Tyana

quote: We learn from each other. We learn from others' mistakes, from their experience, their wisdom. It makes it easier for us to come to better decisions in our own lives.
author: Adrian Grenier

quote: Wisdom cannot come by railroad or automobile or aeroplane, or be hurried up by telegraph or telephone.
author: John Burroughs

quote: Age does not bring you wisdom, age brings you wrinkles.
author: Estelle Getty

quote: The wisdom of age: don't stop walking.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: Knowing that you are going to die is, I suspect, the beginning of wisdom.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Knowledge shrinks as wisdom grows.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Who is wise in love, love most, say least.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: If I don't have wisdom, I can teach you only ignorance.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Seek the lofty by reading, hearing and seeing great work at some moment every day.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: Words of wisdom are spoken by children at least as often as scientists.
author: James Newman

quote: Every one in the world ought to do the things for which he is specially adapted. It is the part of wisdom to recognize what each one of us is best fitted for, and it is the part of education to perfect and utilize such predispositions. Because education can direct and aid nature but can never transform her.
author: Maria Montessori

quote: Perspective is worth 80 IQ points.
author: Alan Kay

quote: Many of us spend half of our time wishing for things we could have if we didn't spend half our time wishing.
author: Alexander Woollcott

quote: Better mad with the rest of the world than wise alone.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: Wisdom begins at the end.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: Wisdom is the quality that keeps you from getting into situations where you need it.
author: Doug Larson

quote: He who lives by the crystal ball soon learns to eat ground glass.
author: Edgar Fiedler

quote: A man begins cutting his wisdom teeth the first time he bites off more than he can chew.
author: Herb Caen

quote: Strong characters are brought out by change of situation, and gentle ones by permanence.
author: Jean Paul

quote: Wisdom we know is the knowledge of good and evil, not the strength to choose between the two.
author: John Cheever

quote: A man should always consider how much he has more than he wants.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: It is not who is right, but what is right, that is of importance.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: Wisdom doesn't necessarily come with age. Sometimes age just shows up all by itself.
author: Tom Wilson

quote: Let us act on what we have, since we have not what we wish.
author: John Henry Newman

quote: If fortune favors you do not be elated if she frowns do not despond.
author: Ausonius

quote: Giving opens the way for receiving.
author: Florence Scovel Shinn

quote: Meditation is the soul's perspective glass.
author: Owen Feltham

quote: Above all, you must fight conceit, envy, and every kind of ill-feeling in your heart.
author: Abraham Cahan

quote: Everything important always begins from something trivial.
author: Donald Hall

quote: A short saying often contains much wisdom.
author: Sophocles

quote: Lord, give us the wisdom to utter words that are gentle and tender, for tomorrow we may have to eat them.
author: Mo Udall

quote: Has fortune dealt you some bad cards. Then let wisdom make you a good gamester.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: He who is taught to live upon little owes more to his father's wisdom than he who has a great deal left him does to his father's care.
author: William Penn

quote: Wisdom is not attained by years, but by ability.
author: Plautus

quote: You want people walking away from the conversation with some kernel of wisdom or some kind of impact.
author: Harry Dean Stanton

quote: Economists often like startling theorems, results which seem to run counter to conventional wisdom.
author: Joseph Stiglitz

quote: The wisdom acquired with the passage of time is a useless gift unless you share it.
author: Esther Williams

quote: It's very hard to know what wisdom is.
author: James Hillman

quote: In the frank expression of conflicting opinions lies the greatest promise of wisdom in governmental action.
author: Louis D. Brandeis

quote: It is good even for old men to learn wisdom.
author: Aeschylus

quote: There is as much wisdom in listening as there is in speaking - and that goes for all relationships, not just romantic ones.
author: Daniel Dae Kim

quote: We all have within us a deep wisdom, but sometimes we don't know we have it.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: I'm someone who's done the opposite of whatever the received wisdom is, to keep your career going into your 50s.
author: Elizabeth McGovern

quote: You know, many people have said that I'm on the edge and I'm maverick for some of the big operations that I've done. I'm not at all. I pray; I ask God to give me wisdom, 'Should I do it?', guidance in terms of how to do it, who to consult with. All those kind of things are incredibly important.
author: Ben Carson

quote: I don't turn to greeting cards for wisdom and advice, but they are a fine reflection of the general drift of the culture.
author: Susan Orlean

quote: I don't want to put a pause on the rest of my life I'm really enjoying getting older and the wisdom that comes from that.
author: Rosemarie DeWitt

quote: I think I got a lot of life skills I got a lot of wisdom I've seen a lot of bad things happen to a lot of good people.
author: Young Jeezy

quote: I had more energy at 50. On the other hand, at 75, I've probably got a little more wisdom and good judgment than I had at 50 because I've got more experience. But I haven't really changed. I'm still driven by the same philosophy.
author: Ted Turner

quote: By the time you've reached your sixties, you do know that one day you will die, and knowing that is at least the beginning of wisdom.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: While I have no empirical evidence to back this up, I bet that the number of homosexual people per thousand has not fluctuated all that much over the centuries. I do not believe the dented wisdom my father used to extol, that homosexuality was a sure sign of a civilization in decline.
author: Henry Rollins

quote: My first spoken word poem, packed with all the wisdom of a 14-year-old, was about the injustice of being seen as unfeminine. The poem was very indignant, and mainly exaggerated, but the only spoken word poetry that I had seen up until that point was mainly indignant, so I thought that that's what was expected of me.
author: Sarah Kay

quote: For most of us, wisdom is acquired in the thicket of experience and usually meets us somewhere along the way if we live long enough. But sooner is better than later.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

quote: You need to have extraordinary wisdom to be the forerunner.
author: Ma Huateng

quote: First a piece of Irish wisdom: you should always listen to a bookie. For they have a saying, 'Money tells a good story,' and somewhere in their odds is a kind of science-fiction existentialism that decrees that we, the people, know everything. In other words, betting patterns often make for good, unconscious soothsaying.
author: Frank Delaney

quote: By definition, the Singularity means that machines would be smarter than us, and, in their wisdom, they can innovate new technologies. The innovations would come so quickly, and increasingly quickly, that the innovation would make Moore's Law seem as antiquated as Hammurabi's Code.
author: Marvin Ammori

quote: The All-Wise Maker attaches hundreds of instances of wisdom to each of the beings in the palace of the universe and equips them to perform hundreds of duties. To all trees He bestows instances of wisdom to the number of its fruits and gives duties to the number of its flowers.
author: Said Nursi

quote: Keep well that is the half of wisdom and of happiness.
author: Emile Zola

quote: The more you meditate on the laws of Moses, the more striking and brighter does their wisdom appear.
author: John Quincy Adams

quote: A cardinal rule in budgeting and saving is to pay yourself first. Once your paycheck hits your account, wisdom has it that you should move some amount to savings even before you pay the bills.
author: John Rampton

quote: For myself, I think that those who cultivate wisdom and believe themselves able to instruct their fellow-citizens as to their interests are least likely to become partisans of violence. They are too well aware that to violence attach enmities and dangers, whereas results as good may be obtained by persuasion safely and amicably.
author: Xenophon

quote: We must work toward cyber doctrine that reflects the wisdom of free markets, private competition, and the important but limited role of government in establishing and enforcing the rule of law, honoring the rights of personal property, the benefits of free and fair trade, and the fundamental principles of liberty.
author: Thomas Bossert

quote: Contrary to popular wisdom, the mark of a great meeting is not how short it is or whether it ends on time. The key is whether it ends with clarity and commitment from participants.
author: Patrick Lencioni

quote: Those who govern, having much business on their hands, do not generally like to take the trouble of considering and carrying into execution new projects. The best public measures are therefore seldom adopted from previous wisdom, but forced by the occasion.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Wisdom and understanding can only become the possession of individual men by travelling the old road of observation, attention, perseverance, and industry.
author: Samuel Smiles

quote: Wisdom allows nothing to be good that will not be so forever no man to be happy but he that needs no other happiness than what he has within himself no man to be great or powerful that is not master of himself.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Wisdom denotes the pursuing of the best ends by the best means.
author: Francis Hutcheson

quote: The clouds may drop down titles and estates, and wealth may seek us, but wisdom must be sought.
author: Edward Young

quote: The gods do not need sacrifices, so what might one do to please them? Acquire wisdom, it seems to me, and do all the good in one's power to those humans who deserve it.
author: Apollonius of Tyana

quote: I don't see the wisdom in modern politicians that I once saw in men like Dean Acheson, David Bruce, or George Marshall. In my day, the northeastern establishment dominated foreign policy formulation, but the composition and distribution of our population is very different today.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: So confident am I in the intentions, as well as wisdom, of the government, that I shall always be satisfied that what is not done, either cannot, or ought not to be done.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: However glorious an action in itself, it ought not to pass for great if it be not the effect of wisdom and intention.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: At sixty, I know little more about wisdom than I did at thirty, but I know a great deal more about folly.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: Blessed are they who seek to learn wisdom.
author: Ezra Taft Benson

quote: Just the simple act of sharing wisdom is something that many parents have left to society to do; however, that is not what God teaches in His word.
author: Monica Johnson

quote: Alas, those six unfortunate souls who have made their way through my books know that every one of them is about Emerson and Thoreau and their dark counters, Melville and Emily Dickinson. Try as I might, I can't get their inspirations, their challenges and sentences and wisdom and questions out of my head.
author: Pico Iyer

quote: Just look at what is right in front of you. People don't do that. They see what they expect to see, what they want to see, what conventional wisdom tells them to see. They only hear the music and not the lyrics of human events.
author: Vincent Bugliosi

quote: This society in which we live is radically changing. What previous generations saw as evil is now embraced as being good. It is a dangerous and slippery slope upon which we stand when we reject what Solomon called the beginning of wisdom - the fear of God.
author: Ray Comfort

quote: Wisdom has its root in goodness, not goodness its root in wisdom.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: All this worldly wisdom was once the unamiable heresy of some wise man.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: I'm a member of the 1960s generation. We didn't have any wisdom.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: Excellence, then, is a state concerned with choice, lying in a mean, relative to us, this being determined by reason and in the way in which the man of practical wisdom would determine it.
author: Aristotle

quote: I consider wisdom supernatural because it isn't taught by men - it's a gift from God.
author: Joyce Meyer

quote: I reject most conventional wisdom.
author: Rush Limbaugh

quote: Champions invariably have fervent philosophical beliefs. Philosophy, in its simplest terms, means 'the love of wisdom.'
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: Everything in the world may be endured except continual prosperity.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Wisdom stands at the turn in the road and calls upon us publicly, but we consider it false and despise its adherents.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: It is great folly to wish to be wise all alone.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: We give advice, but we cannot give the wisdom to profit by it.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Few people have the wisdom to prefer the criticism that would do them good, to the praise that deceives them.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: My company survives because I've learned to respect the ideas of people younger than me and recognize when my wisdom is obsolete.
author: Robert Kiyosaki

quote: The function of wisdom is to discriminate between good and evil.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Rightly defined philosophy is simply the love of wisdom.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Wisdom is a sacred communion.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: It used to be, it is accepted scientific wisdom the Earth is flat, and this heretic named Galileo was branded a denier.
author: Ted Cruz

quote: In the beginning, Adam was instructed to earn the bread by the sweat of his brow - not Eve. Contrary to conventional wisdom, a mother's place is in the home!
author: Ezra Taft Benson

quote: Young people, you need the wisdom of age, just as some of us older ones need your enthusiasm for life.
author: Ezra Taft Benson

quote: Now that I am sixty, I see why the idea of elder wisdom has passed from currency.
author: John Updike

quote: The Founding Fathers in their wisdom decided that children were an unnatural strain on parents. So they provided jails called schools, equipped with tortures called an education.
author: John Updike

quote: The 'Reader's Digest' used to run a feature called 'It Pays to Increase Your Word Power.' The new wisdom - post-Trump and Brexit - is that it doesn't.
author: Howard Jacobson

quote: The conventional wisdom is that if you are gay, you cannot play the romantic straight lead in a movie.
author: Ian Mckellen

quote: In my definition of consciousness, consciousness is the same thing as life. What wisdom traditions also call spirit.
author: Deepak Chopra

quote: Don't follow any advice, no matter how good, until you feel as deeply in your spirit as you think in your mind that the counsel is wise.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: The older I get the more wisdom I find in the ancient rule of taking first things first. A process which often reduces the most complex human problem to a manageable proportion.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: When you doubt, abstain.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Conventional wisdom on government's role in inequality often has it backwards. Tax reforms have resulted in a more progressive federal income tax government transfer payments have become less progressive.
author: Paul Ryan

quote: In the long-run every Government is the exact symbol of its People, with their wisdom and unwisdom; we have to say, Like People like Government.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Though sages may pour out their wisdom's treasure, there is no sterner moralist than pleasure.
author: Lord Byron

quote: God knows and sees all. His wisdom and knowledge far outweighs mankind, and whether or not people ever recognize it - He is the creator. He is the giver of life, and only He has the power to take it away. That's why its imperative to submit to Him.
author: Monica Johnson

quote: The philosophy I love is very selective. It is really just the bit that is involved in a search for wisdom, and this means a short roll call of names; Socrates, Marcus Aurelius, Seneca, Epicurus, Montaigne, Schopenhauer, Nietzsche.
author: Alain de Botton

quote: I'm not an academic philosopher, and don't agree with the way the universities approach the subject. I'm a philosopher only in the very loose sense of someone interested in wisdom and well-being attained through reason. But I'm as interested in psychoanalysis and art as I am in philosophy.
author: Alain de Botton

quote: Much wisdom often goes with fewest words.
author: Sophocles

quote: Wisdom may best arise from a humbling reality.
author: Michael Leunig

quote: Nothing energizes me more than to burrow myself under a pile of received wisdom and emerge triumphant with the truth.
author: Timothy Noah

quote: Success is a wonderful thing, but it tends not to be the sort of experience that we learn from. We enjoy it; perhaps we even deserve it. But we don't acquire wisdom from it.
author: Timothy Noah

quote: I am deeply impressed with the gravity and wisdom with which most federal judges approach the responsibility of sentencing. It is a difficult, soul-searching task at best.
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: Sometimes you surprise yourself with what you can handle, and if you come out the other end with some wisdom, then it's not such a bad thing.
author: Boy George

quote: How do you rate works of genius? Partly by personal inclination, partly by accepted wisdom, partly by popularity.
author: Robert Gottlieb

quote: In the vain laughter of folly wisdom hears half its applause.
author: George Eliot

quote: More helpful than all wisdom is one draught of simple human pity that will not forsake us.
author: George Eliot

quote: As great as Ed is, the wisdom out here is that he can't carry a movie. They'll pay him $3 million to be the second banana in Julia Roberts things. But they won't put up $3 million for an Ed Harris movie.
author: George A. Romero

quote: If you're a Supreme Court justice, the American people have elevated you to one of the highest offices in the land out of the goodness of their heart and out of deference to your legal wisdom. You get a lifetime appointment, limitless prestige, a great office, and what I have to assume is a very comfortable chair.
author: Donna Brazile

quote: At 17 years old, STG took me under its wing and shared its resources and wisdom with me, even allowing me to take part in a show at the Edinburgh Festival. Without STG and the Ramshorn Theatre, I would not have found access to the world of drama that I later made my profession.
author: Peter Capaldi

quote: Up until Trump announced his candidacy, the conventional wisdom was that you had to be a professional politician in order to run. You had to have a background that was politically scrubbed. In other words, smart people who didn't live perfect lives could never run.
author: Mark Cuban

quote: I want to dip my foot in some acting. And most definitely want to mentor upcoming artists and give them the wisdom that was given to me.
author: Missy Elliott

quote: To think ill of mankind and not wish ill to them, is perhaps the highest wisdom and virtue.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: I associate wisdom and grace with age.
author: Christy Turlington

quote: We know there is a deep reservoir of food wisdom out there, or else humans would not have survived to the extent we have. Much of this food wisdom is worth preserving and reviving and heeding.
author: Michael Pollan

quote: I always want to be a messenger, a person that, you know, that's not afraid to pass on wisdom.
author: Mary J. Blige

quote: Tis but a part we see, and not a whole.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Almost every wise saying has an opposite one, no less wise, to balance it.
author: George Santayana

quote: Wisdom comes by disillusionment.
author: George Santayana

quote: The hunger for facile wisdom is the root of all false philosophy.
author: George Santayana

quote: What we call wisdom is the result of all the wisdom of past ages. Our best institutions are like young trees growing upon the roots of the old trunks that have crumbled away.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Rediscovering the wisdom of love and compassion may help us survive at a time when an increasingly balkanized world so badly needs it.
author: Dean Ornish

quote: In my own personal life, God plays a great role in the risk, because I pray before I go into the operating room for every case, and I ask him to give me wisdom, to help me to know what to do - and not only for operating, but for everything.
author: Ben Carson

quote: I pray before I go into the operating room for every case, and I ask him to give me wisdom, to help me to know what to do - and not only for operating, but for everything.
author: Ben Carson

quote: For all my education, accomplishments, and so called 'wisdom'... I can't fathom my own heart.
author: Michael Caine

quote: Wisdom is not wisdom when it is derived from books alone.
author: Horace

quote: Most of our pocket wisdom is conceived for the use of mediocre people, to discourage them from ambitious attempts, and generally console them in their mediocrity.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: What is the price of experience? Do men buy it for a song? Or wisdom for a dance in the street? No, it is bought with the price of all the man hath, his house, his wife, his children.
author: William Blake

quote: Global security can be formed or threatened by heads of state whose wisdom, folly and obsessions shape global events. But often it is the security practitioners, those rarely in the headlines but whose craft and energy quietly break new ground, who keep us safe or put us in peril.
author: Michael Hayden

quote: To build a great company, which is a CEO's job, sometimes you have to stand up against conventional wisdom.
author: Carly Fiorina

quote: The wisdom of the crowds has peaked. Web 3.0 is taking what we've built in Web 2.0 - the wisdom of the crowds - and putting an editorial layer on it of truly talented, compensated people to make the product more trusted and refined.
author: Jason Calacanis

quote: Everyone talks about how, in your 30s, all of these growing pains transition into wisdom and you feel more self-assured and confident, but I think I had a bit of a jump-start on that at 27.
author: Solange Knowles

quote: Wisdom is that apprehension of heavenly things to which the spirit rises through love.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Arianna Huffington has exercised her renowned wisdom to give journalism another boost along the ever busier Internet. Her blog site promises to be an interesting challenge for those of us lucky enough to be invited to participate with our occasional contributions.
author: Walter Cronkite

quote: Of prosperity mortals can never have enough.
author: Aeschylus

quote: I'm not a mom, but I think the word 'mother' is about wisdom.
author: Margaret Cho

quote: You have to find out what's right for you, so it's trial and error. You are going to be all right if you accept realistic goals for yourself.
author: Teri Garr

quote: What if Barack Obama established a Presidential Advisory Committee that would meet once every couple of months, bringing together the former presidents for a conference in order to seek their collective wisdom? There is a wealth of experience in former presidents that generally goes untapped.
author: Tony Campolo

quote: Surely wisdom will come as we listen to learn from children, parents, partners, neighbors, Church leaders, and the Lord.
author: Russell M. Nelson

quote: Around '93, '94, the conventional wisdom about the Internet was that it was a toy for academics and researchers. So it was very, very underestimated for about two years.
author: Marc Andreessen

quote: There's a lot of wisdom that my dad and my grandparents and my uncle have been able to impart on me, and what I've treasured the most is I've seen examples in my life of people embracing their creativity, not feeling insecure about their artistic inclinations.
author: Bryce Dallas Howard

quote: In complete darkness, it is only knowledge and wisdom that separates us.
author: Janet Jackson

quote: Without wisdom, the future has no meaning, no valuable purpose.
author: Herbie Hancock

quote: You can practice to attain knowledge, but you can't practice to attain wisdom.
author: Herbie Hancock

quote: Don't ask for a million dollars. Ask for the stuff that'll get you a million dollars - your health, your brain, your sanity, wisdom. Prepare me for when I do get that million. Make sure I don't go crazy, make sure I help my family.
author: Future

quote: Conventional wisdom is not always the best wisdom.
author: Doug Ducey

quote: The wisdom of God is so great that He also knows exactly what I would think and do under every possible circumstance and situation, and he placed me in that state of life and situation best suited for my salvation.
author: Mother Angelica

quote: My abiding faith in the wisdom of our electorate is what gives me hope.
author: Kapil Sibal

quote: Wisdom consists not so much in knowing what to do in the ultimate as knowing what to do next.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: Our own physical body possesses a wisdom which we who inhabit the body lack. We give it orders which make no sense.
author: Henry Miller

quote: It's received wisdom that the English are uniquely child-unfriendly.
author: Julie Burchill

quote: Moderation is the inseparable companion of wisdom, but with it genius has not even a nodding acquaintance.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: There is this difference between happiness and wisdom: he that thinks himself the happiest man, really is so; but he that thinks himself the wisest, is generally the greatest fool.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Doubt is the vestibule through which all must pass before they can enter into the temple of wisdom.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Our ascendancy of the past two centuries - first Europe and then the U.S. - has bred a western-centric mentality: the West is the fount of all wisdom. We think of ourselves as open-minded, but our sense of superiority has closed our minds. We never entertained the idea that China could surpass the U.S.
author: Martin Jacques

quote: While conventional wisdom has traditionally sided against borrowing from retirement savings, sentiment has shifted toward borrowing from one's own assets with the realization that other forms of credit come at a much higher cost and often are not even available to borrowers with limited means and urgent needs.
author: Elaine Chao

quote: Where can we find greater structural clarity than in the wooden buildings of old? Where else can we find such unity of material, construction and form? here, the wisdom of whole generations is stored.
author: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe

quote: The Ohio Legislature's passed a law to allow concealed weapons in day care centers, but interesting: this same Legislature, in its wisdom, doesn't allow concealed weapons in the statehouse.
author: Sherrod Brown

quote: Focus on the mind and the soul. Read. Study. Enrol in a course of lectures. Pray. Become a member of a religious congregation. Study the Bible or other ancient works of wisdom.
author: Jonathan Sacks

quote: I don't know that you're able to measure your aggregate wisdom as you go through life. I can't say that I ever feel that I'm sitting on top of a growing mound of wisdom.
author: Dylan Moran

quote: It is a remarkable fact in the political history of man that there is scarcely an instance of a free constitutional government which has been the work exclusively of foresight and wisdom. They have all been the result of a fortunate combination of circumstances.
author: John C. Calhoun

quote: History does not repeat itself. Nor does it unfold in cycles. The real future is contingent, rich beyond imagining, a perennial gobsmack, tragic and glorious in equal measure; the pundits' future, spun of 'conventional wisdom,' is only a sucker punch to that common-sense fact.
author: Rick Perlstein

quote: If your writing collides with the conventional wisdom, there's going to be some kind of friction.
author: Pankaj Mishra

quote: Democracy, loudly upheld as a cure for much of the ailing world, has proved no guarantor of political wisdom, even if it remains the least bad form of government.
author: Pankaj Mishra

quote: Animals, in their generation, are wiser than the sons of men; but their wisdom is confined to a few particulars, and lies in a very narrow compass.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: The wisdom of God's Word is quite clear on believers being unequally yoked. And marrying someone who is not a Christian - who is not a daily disciple of Christ - is being unequally yoked, regardless of what their beliefs might be.
author: Pat Robertson

quote: My mother is a great source of advice and wisdom and consolation for me.
author: Katherine Heigl

quote: I'm now the elder in the position of doling out wisdom and trying to mend fences.
author: Jane Fonda

quote: Novels are the Socratic dialogues of our time. Practical wisdom fled from school wisdom into this liberal form.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: You can only make sense of the online world by going offline and by getting the wisdom and emotional clarity to know how to make the best use of the Internet.
author: Pico Iyer

quote: The conventional wisdom is that people come to the United States, and immigration is so great, and they say, 'America, what a great country.' And a lot of that is true.
author: James Gray

quote: I would like to do my own daily talk show. Wisdom is the gift of ageing no young person can have or buy it. My success was and is self-evident. I'm alive. I've lived. I've thrived and have grown as a person. I'm now healthier than ever. Who can argue with that?
author: Suzanne Somers

quote: Honesty is the rarest wealth anyone can possess, and yet all the honesty in the world ain't lawful tender for a loaf of bread.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Learning sleeps and snores in libraries, but wisdom is everywhere, wide awake, on tiptoe.
author: Josh Billings

quote: You should never ask a horse or an actor to do something they cannot do. Wisdom will teach you to find out what they can do and then make it easy for them.
author: Tommy Lee Jones

quote: Common wisdom dictates that the vice president should provide balance to the ticket by representing a different part of the country, another set of experiences, or a basketful of electoral votes.
author: Madeleine M. Kunin

quote: A lot of people tell me a lot of things about my conduct, my game, my future... but I try to stay away from their words of wisdom. I don't let it distract me. On the field, you will be facing the ball alone. If you fail, you will the only one to blame. So, you should be the one deciding for yourself.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: Wisdom lies neither in fixity nor in change, but in the dialectic between the two.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: Wisdom lies neither in fixity nor in change, but in the dialectic between the two. A constant coming and going: wisdom lies in the momentary.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: Along with success comes a reputation for wisdom.
author: Euripides

quote: Some wisdom you must learn from one who's wise.
author: Euripides

quote: The problem with Google is you have 360 degrees of omnidirectional information on a linear basis, but the algorithms for irony and ambiguity are not there. And those are the algorithms of wisdom.
author: William Hurt

quote: My dad was a man of great wisdom in his short time here.
author: Bonnie Hunt

quote: To advise is not to compel.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: The plan was criticized by some retired military officers embedded in TV studios. But with every advance by our coalition forces, the wisdom of that plan becomes more apparent.
author: Dick Cheney

quote: I've matured as a writer and human being. I've got some wisdom under my belt.
author: Carlene Carter

quote: When I was at drama school, I wanted to change the world, and thought I had some great wisdom to impart to people about humanity. Now that I'm older, I know enough to realise that I know nothing at all.
author: Michael Sheen

quote: You must accept responsibility for your actions, but not the credit for your achievements.
author: Denis Waitley

quote: No one ever found wisdom without also being a fool. Writers, alas, have to be fools in public, while the rest of the human race can cover its tracks.
author: Erica Jong

quote: Spending two years on my uncle's ranch in Montana as a young man gave me the wisdom and the thrust to do westerns.
author: Robert Duvall

quote: Many spiritual teachers - in Buddhism, in Islam - have talked about first-hand experience of the world as an important part of the path to wisdom, to enlightenment.
author: bell hooks

quote: I love being. There's so much wisdom in it. You wake up in the morning and you think, Hey, isn't it great just being?
author: Gwyneth Paltrow

quote: Outside of hip-hop, it was in comics that I most often found the aesthetics and wisdom of my world reflected.
author: Ta-Nehisi Coates

quote: Real history is far more complex and interesting than the simplistic summaries presented in Wikipedia articles. Knowing this allows you to question received wisdom, to challenge 'facts' 'everybody' knows to be true, and to imagine worlds and characters worthy of our rich historical heritage and our complex selves.
author: Ken Liu

quote: The blowback against a bailout of Lehman would have been fierce. It is often forgotten, but the prevailing wisdom the day after Lehman fell was that its collapse was a good thing.
author: Andrew Ross Sorkin

quote: In science, as in art, and, as I believe, in every other sphere of human activity, there may be wisdom in a multitude of counsellors, but it is only in one or two of them.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: Thinking is not enough. There is no final enough of wisdom, experience - any... thing.
author: William S. Burroughs

quote: We are all responsible to Jesus first, and then, under him, to various other persons and offices. Discerning the path of love and obedience when two or more of these submissive relationships collide is a call to humble, Bible-saturated, spiritual wisdom.
author: John Piper

quote: I always see where I didn't do things the right way. I only see the heavy lifting. That's a bit of my wisdom, if you want to call it that.
author: Vera Wang

quote: If to live is to progress, if you are lucky, from foolishness to wisdom, then to write novels is to broadcast the various stages of your foolishness.
author: Jane Smiley

quote: We have no words for speaking of wisdom to the stupid. He who understands the wise is wise already.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quote: It is almost everywhere the case that soon after it is begotten the greater part of human wisdom is laid to rest in repositories.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quote: It may almost be a question whether such wisdom as many of us have in our mature years has not come from the dying out of the power of temptation, rather than as the results of thought and resolution.
author: Anthony Trollope

quote: Full of wisdom are the ordinations of fate.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: As we work to reweave the strands of connection, we can be supported by the wisdom and lovingkindness of others.
author: Sharon Salzberg

quote: There's a conventional wisdom that says that strategic thinking is much more important than relationship building, which doesn't seem to be nearly as highly valued as it should be, based on what some of the leaders that I've spoken with have said to me.
author: Tom Rath

quote: I don't think you can come into your wisdom until you have made mistakes on your own skin and felt them in reality of your own life.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: Now our founding fathers had the wisdom to know that social acceptance and popularity were fleeing, and that this country's principles needed to be rooted in strengths greater than the passions and the emotions of the times.
author: Chris Christie

quote: Saudi Arabia is a puritanical state that claims a monopoly of wisdom and virtue.
author: James Buchan

quote: I'm exploring the maturity, the wisdom that just comes from having gone around the sun 50 times. My experience is, 'Oh, I'm never really going to get it right. I'm never going to get it done. But that's not the point here.' The point is the journey.
author: Melissa Etheridge

quote: In the end, the real wisdom of menopause may be in questioning how fun or even sane this chore wheel called modern life actually is.
author: Sandra Tsing Loh

quote: After 25-plus years as a lawyer, prosecutor, and defense attorney, I have developed a deep appreciation for both the wisdom of the law and the role that jurists play in framing the rights and responsibilities that define our society.
author: Eliot Spitzer

quote: I listen to the older people who talk to me. I call them my old heads, people with a lot of wisdom. They'll teach you a lot if you listen.
author: Stefon Diggs

quote: There's a real wisdom to not saying a thing.
author: Willem Dafoe

quote: I'd love to spend more time on the Isle of Man. I love the anonymity of putting on a boiler suit and going down to buy parts for the compressor. And Norman Wisdom's a neighbour I salute him occasionally.
author: John Rhys-Davies

quote: I'm not wise, but the beginning of wisdom is there; it's like relaxing into - and an acceptance of - things.
author: Tina Turner

quote: Why would anyone walk through life satisfied with the light from the candle of their own understanding when, by reaching out to our Heavenly Father, they could experience the bright sun of spiritual knowledge that would expand their minds with wisdom and fill their souls with joy?
author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf

quote: It's really important, whether you're a conservative or a liberal, to always challenge the conventional wisdom, which is what I've tried to do in all my work.
author: Nina Easton

quote: It's become glib political conventional wisdom in Washington that a massive spending plan will provide a parachute rescue for a cliff-diving economy - landing it safely and with strong enough legs to move toward a healthy future.
author: Nina Easton

quote: The beauty of age is we grow, we learn. We have more wisdom. And as much as the youth-glorifying Hollywood would like us to believe, it's nothing. They're wrong.
author: Sherilyn Fenn

quote: Most people see what they expect to see, what they want to see, what they've been told to see, what conventional wisdom tells them to see - not what is right in front of them in its pristine condition.
author: Vincent Bugliosi

quote: I'm grateful for my lines of wisdom. Of course, there are days when I think: 'Oh my gawd, I look a bit tired.' But I can pull it together if I have to.
author: Twiggy

quote: For the Holy Ghost blesses us with optimism and wisdom at times of challenge that we simply cannot muster on our own.
author: Sheri L. Dew

quote: When I was born, the wisdom was that homosexuality was an illness; that it was caused largely by somebody's mother, and a distorted relationship with the mother. And now, as I live my life - married to a husband, with kids - it's an identity.
author: Andrew Solomon

quote: Once I turned 35, I got the bonus of some wisdom and began to accept life on its own terms.
author: Mike Myers

quote: Whatever one thinks of the wisdom of building a mosque near Ground Zero, this controversy now affords us an immense opportunity to examine who we are as a people. It provides us with the opportunity to get back to our foundational ideals, which have always stood as a beacon for the rest of the world.
author: Hamza Yusuf

quote: I'm at the transition place myself, still playing high school girls but moving to a stage when I'm playing older roles and going to the places of stillness and wisdom and knowledge and weight. It's exciting and scary.
author: Tatiana Maslany

quote: Wisdom alone is true ambition's aim, wisdom is the source of virtue and of fame; obtained with labour, for mankind employed, and then, when most you share it, best enjoyed.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: I knew that I had it tough compared to children around me. But I felt like I needed it. I think I had the wisdom as a child to know that it would help me later on.
author: Troy Polamalu

quote: India and China have not shied away from addressing boundary questions, have wisdom to find a fair and mutually acceptable solution... We have been able to put all issues on the table.
author: Li Keqiang

quote: I feel like I've matured more musically than I have personally. But I totally embrace what becoming older has to offer. I find the wisdom that comes with each passing year is a trip.
author: Kirk Hammett

quote: Age is a terrible avenger. The lessons of life give you so much to work with, but by the time you've got all this great wisdom, you don't get to be young anymore.
author: Elizabeth Wurtzel

quote: The left has come to regard common sense - the traditional wisdom and folkways of the community - as an obstacle to progress and enlightenment.
author: Christopher Lasch

quote: Consider this point. It is a main point of true wisdom. Whenever there is an execution of purpose, there must be an agent.
author: Adoniram Judson

quote: Rarely promise, but, if lawful, constantly perform.
author: William Penn

quote: The wisdom and experience of older people is a resource of inestimable worth. Recognizing and treasuring the contributions of older people is essential to the long-term flourishing of any society.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: What the tech industry often forgets is that with age comes wisdom. Older workers are usually better at following direction, mentoring, and leading.
author: Vivek Wadhwa

quote: I understand that there's a certain energy in youth, no question, in terms of pursuing jobs. But there is wisdom in age. It's too bad that the two can't come together because I do think that people are dropped from what they're really good at too soon.
author: Rene Russo

quote: A musical, like most religions, provides the audience or followers with a sense of belonging. Religious services, on the other hand, with their staged performances, invigorating songs, popular wisdom and shared experience, are almost a form of community theater.
author: Lisa Randall

quote: It is one thing to oppose a bill and say, 'Well, I'm smarter than the other side and have more wisdom than they do,' but it is another thing to oppose a law because it violates the very principles upon which this country was founded.
author: Scott Garrett

quote: Trouble shared is trouble halved.
author: Lee Iacocca

quote: I believe the reason we sleep is not just to allow our body to rest but that it is to allow this inner wisdom to speak to us through symbols. This includes the body or somatic problems as well as psychological ones. Dreams and drawings are useful in diagnosing physical conditions.
author: Bernie Siegel

quote: I'm always feeling like I'm lacking wisdom. This reassurance that one can ask God for that and it will happen is certainly reassuring to me.
author: Francis Collins

quote: None knows the weight of another's burden.
author: George Herbert

quote: I'm particularly interested in black swan events: unprecedented surprises that destroy the conventional wisdom about how the world works.
author: Paolo Bacigalupi

quote: Women's strength, women's industry, women's wisdom are humankind's greatest untapped resource. The challenge then for U.N. Women is to show our diverse constituencies how this resource can be effectively tapped in ways that benefit us all.
author: Michelle Bachelet

quote: We simply can no longer afford to deny the full potential of one half of the population. The world needs to tap into the talent and wisdom of women. Whether the issue is food security, economic recovery, health, or peace and security, the participation of women is needed now more than ever.
author: Michelle Bachelet

quote: 'Focusing' is no conventional repackaging of self-help wisdom. It is at once a manual and a philosophy. It talks about the body's wisdom, the steps of the focusing technique, how to discover the richness in others by learning to listen.
author: Marilyn Ferguson

quote: When you're used to being prepared to reject conventional wisdom, it leaves you open to learn more.
author: Mayim Bialik

quote: If everything is going well in my life then I start to read the papers more and I start to worry about everything I can't deal with. They say wisdom is knowing what you can fix and what you can't change. I'm very unwise.
author: Josh Hartnett

quote: If you and I desire the blessings of life, of health, of vigor of body and mind; if we desire the destroying angel to pass us by, as he did in the days of the children of Israel, we must obey the Word of Wisdom; then God is bound, and the blessing shall come to us.
author: Heber J. Grant

quote: Kabbalah is all about change. It isn't about being proud of our good qualities: the wisdom is about transforming our darkness into light.
author: Yehuda Berg

quote: The soul's joy lies in doing.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Ending poverty calls for humility, honesty, freedom from ideology and refusal to accept cruel simplicities about anyone's human potential. It requires listening to the wisdom and cutting the nonsense from both the Right and the Left.
author: Donella Meadows

quote: As with many other folk beliefs, 'feng-shui' undoubtedly incorporates some scientifically correct observation or received wisdom based on direct experience of natural phenomena; but it needs to be dealt with skeptically as a credible system of thought. Some feng-shui prescriptions can certainly lead to desirable results.
author: Martin Filler

quote: For me, good films and good books are irreducible to a lesson. You can't just kind of translate them into one statement. On the contrary, the more you do that, the less wisdom in art there is.
author: Pawel Pawlikowski

quote: Few of the many wise apothegms which have been uttered have prevented a single foolish action.
author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

quote: Never say never, but the thought of electively cutting oneself is beyond my grasp, and I also object to it politically. Denying the lines on our faces makes a comment about age and wisdom I don't care to make.
author: Debra Winger

quote: Consensus wisdom has it that all modern commercial fantasy novels fall into two camps: those derived from J.R.R. Tolkien and those derived from Mervyn Peake. The 'Lord of the Rings' template or the 'Gormenghast' mold.
author: Paul Di Filippo

quote: As a parent and a citizen, I'll take a Bill Gates (or Warren Buffett) over Steve Jobs every time. If we must have billionaires, better they should ignore Jobs's example and instead embrace the morality and wisdom of the great industrialist-philanthropist Andrew Carnegie.
author: Eric Alterman

quote: People always blame the girl; she should have said no. A monosyllable, but conventional wisdom has always been that boys can't manage it.
author: Anna Quindlen

quote: It takes a great man to give sound advice tactfully, but a greater to accept it graciously.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: If you do not express your own original ideas, if you do not listen to your own being, you will have betrayed yourself.
author: Rollo May

quote: The wisdom of the wise and the experience of the ages is preserved into perpetuity by a nation's proverbs, fables, folk sayings and quotations.
author: William Feather

quote: Never cut what you can untie.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: With age comes a greater wisdom, an ease and comfort with oneself.
author: Cherie Lunghi

quote: Your art kind of changes as you get older, by nature of the fact that you're hopefully gaining wisdom and you're starting to watch things with a better overview.
author: Sheryl Crow

quote: In life, all good things come hard, but wisdom is the hardest to come by.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: When defeat is inevitable, it is wisest to yield.
author: Quintilian

quote: 'Swan,' by Mary Oliver. Poems and prose. Reading from this book is as if visiting a very wise friend. There is wisdom and welcoming kindness on every page.
author: Jessye Norman

quote: Self-suggestion makes you master of yourself.
author: W. Clement Stone

quote: You are a product of your environment. So choose the environment that will best develop you toward your objective. Analyze your life in terms of its environment. Are the things around you helping you toward success - or are they holding you back?
author: W. Clement Stone

quote: All free governments are managed by the combined wisdom and folly of the people.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: People used to grow up in small communities where folk wisdom was passed down. But we don't live there anymore. We can't go next door to your aunt and ask her for the answers.
author: Clarissa Pinkola Estes

quote: Every journey that is successful has culs-de-sac and speed bumps. I carry a wisdom gene through my life through the good, the bad, and the ugly.
author: Peter Guber

quote: It is always our own self that we find at the end of the journey. The sooner we face that self, the better.
author: Ella Maillart

quote: The difference between chirping out of turn and a faux pas depends on what kind of a bar you're in.
author: Wilson Mizner

quote: The more I work with the body, keeping my assumptions in a temporary state of reservation, the more I appreciate and sympathize with a given disease. The body no longer appears as a sick or irrational demon, but as a process with its own inner logic and wisdom.
author: George MacDonald

quote: I've always shied away from conventional wisdom, though I know the power of it.
author: Peter Jennings

quote: It's not the having, it's the getting.
author: Elizabeth Taylor

quote: It is while you are patiently toiling at the little tasks of life that the meaning and shape of the great whole of life dawn on you.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: We learned in World War II that no single nation holds a monopoly on wisdom, morality or right to power, but that we must fight for the weak and promote democracy.
author: Joe Baca

quote: You lose or you win the fight - and anything in life - in your mind. I can look at how the person walks, how he speaks, his expressions. It's a wisdom. Eyes are the mirror of the soul. So you can read a lot.
author: Wladimir Klitschko

quote: I probably wouldn't be a songwriter if I didn't grow up the way I did. It was difficult and it was at times very scary to grow up in a household so unsettled and at times very violent. But, it also, I guess it earned me a sort of wisdom at a young age that's served me well.
author: Ray LaMontagne

quote: Eventually, we reach the point where we start to realize that we are not going to find peace, contentment, happiness, strength, fearlessness - all of the things that in our heart of hearts we wish we had - outside of us.
author: Guy Finley

quote: There is a trade off - as you grow older you gain wisdom but you lose spontaneity.
author: Kenny Rogers

quote: If you want to go east, don't go west.
author: Ramakrishna

quote: Even youngish men can acquire wisdom as time goes by.
author: John Bercow

quote: Counsel woven into the fabric of real life is wisdom.
author: Walter Benjamin

quote: It is astonishing with how little wisdom mankind can be governed, when that little wisdom is its own.
author: William Ralph Inge

quote: You make a product, and you put it out, and you do it with as much excellence and also wisdom as possible, and then it's the Lord that drives it and determines where it will go.
author: David A. R. White

quote: The wisdom of the wise is an uncommon degree of common sense.
author: Dean Inge

quote: It is much more difficult to measure nonperformance than performance.
author: Harold S. Geneen

quote: The more I draw and write, the more I realise that accidents are a necessary part of any creative act, much more so than logic or wisdom. Sometimes a mistake is the only way of arriving at an original concept, and the history of successful inventions is full of mishaps, serendipity and unintended results.
author: Shaun Tan

quote: I am a poor student sitting at the feet of giants, yearning for their wisdom and begging for lessons that might one day make me a complete artist, so that if all goes well, I may one day sit beside them.
author: Rod Taylor

quote: Except for the grace of God, I would be nobody - and that grace is the opposite of merit - human labour, education or human wisdom.
author: T. B. Joshua

quote: I think there is a complicated side effect to overcoming evil in that we are forever changed by it. I think after we ingest some of the cruelty of the world, it takes years off of our lives, but it also gives us wisdom and a little grace, hopefully a sense of compassion.
author: Adam Rapp

quote: Where fear is present, wisdom cannot be.
author: Lactantius

quote: Wisdom and goodness are twin-born, one heart must hold both sisters, never seen apart.
author: William Dean Howells

quote: The Divine wisdom has given us prayer, not as a means whereby to obtain the good things of earth, but as a means whereby we learn to do without them; not as a means whereby we escape evil, but as a means whereby we become strong to meet it.
author: Frederick William Robertson

quote: All human wisdom works and has worries and grief as reward.
author: Johann Georg Hamann

quote: The sublimity of wisdom is to do those things living, which are to be desired when dying.
author: Norman Douglas

quote: The beginning of wisdom is to desire it.
author: Solomon Ibn Gabirol

quote: It is not from reason that justice springs, but goodness is born of wisdom.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: When I can look life in the eyes, grown calm and very coldly wise, life will have given me the truth, and taken in exchange - my youth.
author: Sara Teasdale

quote: Perhaps too much of everything is as bad as too little.
author: Edna Ferber

quote: You can't sweep other people off their feet, if you can't be swept off your own.
author: Clarence Day

quote: One of the advantages of having gone to Penn State was having had a scholar for a mentor - Philip Young. Also, a professional writer named Philip Klass taught there. He was a science fiction writer whose pseudonym was William Tenn. As a professional writer, he brought wisdom to teaching because he'd done it for a living.
author: David Morrell

quote: People seldom refuse help, if one offers it in the right way.
author: A. C. Benson

quote: However great an evil immorality may be, we must not forget that it is not without its beneficial consequences. It is only through extremes that men can arrive at the middle path of wisdom and virtue.
author: Wilhelm von Humboldt

quote: To comprehend the Wisdom of this Injunction the better, and explain the Duty before us, it should be considered, that Government is the only Means by which human Happiness can be attained.
author: Charles Inglis

quote: Repeat anything often enough and it will start to become you.
author: Tom Hopkins

quote: But the law of God came from heaven indeed. God wrote it with his finger, it is the fountain of all wisdom, and therefore shall it continue for ever, and never have an end.
author: John Jewel

quote: They are few in the midst of an overwhelming mass of brute force, and their submission is wisdom; but for a nation like England to submit to be robbed by any invader who chooses to visit her shores seemed to me to be nonsense.
author: George Combe

quote: He who devotes sixteen hours a day to hard study may become at sixty as wise as he thought himself at twenty.
author: Mary Wilson Little

quote: Wisdom prepares for the worst, but folly leaves the worst for the day when it comes.
author: Richard Cecil

quote: Nobility of spirit has more to do with simplicity than ostentation, wisdom rather than wealth, commitment rather than ambition.
author: Riccardo Muti

quote: We don't pray for the land. We pray for the humans, all humans... starting with the president, Mohammed Morsi, and all officials, and for God to give everyone wisdom and responsibility to manage the affairs of this country and its people in true Egyptian spirit.
author: Pope Theodoros II

quote: I always prayed that God would give me the wisdom and the vision to do the things on this earth that I was supposed to do to express His life and love and His will.
author: Billy Ray Cyrus

quote: Virtues are acquired through endeavor, which rests wholly upon yourself.
author: Sidney Lanier

quote: If the highest things are unknowable, then the highest capacity or virtue of man cannot be theoretical wisdom.
author: Leo Strauss

quote: Public opinion is no more than this: what people think that other people think.
author: Alfred Austin

quote: Wisdom is knowing what to do next virtue is doing it.
author: David Starr Jordan

quote: And it is no less true, that personal security and private property rest entirely upon the wisdom, the stability, and the integrity of the courts of justice.
author: Joseph Story

quote: He dares to be a fool, and that is the first step in the direction of wisdom.
author: James Huneker

quote: The most excellent and divine counsel, the best and most profitable advertisement of all others, but the least practiced, is to study and learn how to know ourselves. This is the foundation of wisdom and the highway to whatever is good.
author: Pierre Charron

quote: Instead of looking at life as a narrowing funnel, we can see it ever widening to choose the things we want to do, to take the wisdom we've learned and create something.
author: Liz Carpenter

quote: If you believe the doctors, nothing is wholesome; if you believe the theologians, nothing is innocent; if you believe the military, nothing is safe.
author: Lord Salisbury

quote: A judge's role is to ensure that the legislature remains within the limits of its assigned authority under the Constitution. Judges have no authority to second-guess the wisdom of the value judgments and policy choices the legislature has made.
author: Paul Watford

quote: Silence and reserve will give anyone a reputation for wisdom.
author: Myrtle Reed

quote: The result showed the wisdom of your orders.
author: John Bigelow

quote: Lord, bless me with the ability to achieve all that I can, and the wisdom to realize it doesn't all have to be by tomorrow!
author: William Eardley IV

quote: Some folks are wise and some are otherwise.
author: Tobias Smollett

quote: The cars we drive say a lot about us.
author: Alexandra Paul

quote: See, when you drive home today, you've got a big windshield on the front of your car. And you've got a little bitty rearview mirror. And the reason the windshield is so large and the rearview mirror is so small is because what's happened in your past is not near as important as what's in your future.
author: Joel Osteen

quote: It's a never ending battle of making your cars better and also trying to be better yourself.
author: Dale Earnhardt

quote: The fact is I don't drive just to get from A to B. I enjoy feeling the car's reactions, becoming part of it.
author: Enzo Ferrari

quote: Maybe the bike is more dangerous, but the passion for the car for me is second to the bike.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: Cars are the sculptures of our everyday lives.
author: Chris Bangle

quote: I've always been asked, 'What is my favorite car?' and I've always said 'The next one.'
author: Carroll Shelby

quote: It's like driving a car at night. You never see further than your headlights, but you can make the whole trip that way.
author: E. L. Doctorow

quote: Everything in life is somewhere else, and you get there in a car.
author: E. B. White

quote: I race to win. If I am on the bike or in a car it will always be the same.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: Shoes make an outfit they're like rims for a car.
author: Omari Hardwick

quote: Television, radio, social media. The 24/7 news cycle plows forward mercilessly on our desks, in our cars and in our pockets. Thousands and thousands of messages and voices bombard us from the moment we wake, fighting for our attention. All we see and hear, all day long, is news. And most of it is bad.
author: Joseph Prince

quote: A racing car is an animal with a thousand adjustments.
author: Mario Andretti

quote: My wife wants sex in the back of the car and she wants me to drive.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

quote: Once you become successful, people know where you live, the type of house you live in, the kind of car you drive, the clothes you wear, and so it would be patronising to go and talk like a welder. Welding's a mystery to me now. You can't go back, your life changes every day.
author: Billy Connolly

quote: A new car is not going to change your life.
author: Monica Ali

quote: Whether you live in a city or a small town, and whether you drive a car, take the bus or ride a train, at some point in the day, everyone is a pedestrian.
author: Anthony Foxx

quote: People think getting a new partner is like getting a new car.
author: Orlando Bloom

quote: We at BMW do not build cars as consumer objects, just to drive from A to B. We build mobile works of art.
author: Chris Bangle

quote: Now, personally, I like a car with some sort of character.
author: Richard Hammond

quote: I will never shave off my beard and moustache. I did once, for charity, but my wife said, 'Good grief, how awful, you look like an American car with all the chrome removed.'
author: Rolf Harris

quote: The year most of my high school friends and I got our driver's permits, the coolest thing one could do was stand outside after school and twirl one's car keys like a lifeguard whistle. That jingling sound meant freedom and power.
author: Sloane Crosley

quote: I hate the hand that comes out of a car and just drops litter in the street. I hate that! For some reason, it just fills me with fury! It's just utter laziness, lack of interest in other people, lack of interest in the planet, in the hedgehog who might eat the plastic bag, it's a lack of concern.
author: Joanna Lumley

quote: Life is a gamble. You can get hurt, but people die in plane crashes, lose their arms and legs in car accidents; people die every day. Same with fighters: some die, some get hurt, some go on. You just don't let yourself believe it will happen to you.
author: Muhammad Ali

quote: Yeah, it's risky, but no more risky than driving a car.
author: Cory Lidle

quote: If you saw a dog going to be crushed under a car, wouldn't you help him?
author: Oskar Schindler

quote: A doctor is not a mechanic. A car doesn't react with a mechanic, but a human being does.
author: Randa Haines

quote: I take cabs if I need to get somewhere or I take car service. I don't drive, I wouldn't mind riding a bike... People think that because you become an entertainer you gotta have this rock star thug image. I'm an artist, man. I'm going to live like an artist.
author: ASAP Rocky

quote: Museums are like the quiet car of the world. It's a place you can come to escape, where there's authenticity, there's uniqueness, there's calm, there's physicality.
author: Thomas P. Campbell

quote: We have lost our vision for the future. Before, we say, 'Nothing will be the same. Cars will fly, and we go to the end of the universe.' We have this kind of naive but exciting idea of the future. Now, the vision has been reduced to ways to select our garbage and how to survive global warming.
author: Jean-Michel Jarre

quote: The majority of my interactions with police were not good. There were a few good ones who were actually protecting the community. But then you have ones from the Valley. They never met me in their life, but since I'm a kid in basketball shorts and a white T-shirt, they wanna slam me on the hood of the car. Sixteen years old.
author: Kendrick Lamar

quote: Engineers are behind the cars we drive, the pills we pop and the way we power our homes.
author: James Dyson

quote: I know a lot about cars, man. I can look at any car's headlights and tell you exactly which way it's coming.
author: Mitch Hedberg
